description.narrative:
Diakonia har ansökt hos Sida om finansiering av 45 MSEK i syfte att genomföra "CSO monitoring Présimètre Programme" i Burkina Faso under perioden 2017-2019. Insatsen syftar till att konsolidera en demokratisk kultur i landet och institutionalisera medborgerlig övervakning av offentlig maktutövning genom användandet av ICT för att: 1) främja och försvara respekten för mänskliga rättigheter; 2) stärka demokratisk kultur, ansvarsutkrävande, politiskt deltagande särskilt för kvinnor och unga samt god samhällsstyrning; 3) övervaka och påverka offentligt beslutsfattande; 4) kräva ökad ekonomisk och social rättvisa; 5) ta frågor relaterade till miljö, vatten och sanitet i beaktande.
Den totala budgeten för insatsen uppgår till 66 MSEK, av vilka Sida finansierar 45 MSEK och övrig finansiering söks från EU, Schweiz och andra potentiella givare.

Diakonia has requested to Sida for funding of 45 million SEK to carry out the ""Program for strengthening political and economic accountability: public policies’ citizen monitoring and ICT www.presimètre.bf"" in Burkina Faso during the period 2016-2020.
The intervention aims at consolidating democratic culture and institutionalize citizen monitoring of public action through the use of ICT by. (1) promotioning, protecting and defencing human rights; (2) strengthening democratic culture, accountability, political participation of women and youth and good governance; (3) monitoring and influence public policies; (4) pleasing for economic and social justice, (5) taking into account issues related to the environment, water and sanitation. Diakonia will implement the intervention together with local civil society organisation.
The intervention’s total budget is 66 million SEK, and the remaining 21 million SEK is to be sought from other donors like EU and Switzerland with whom Diakonia has started a negociation. Approximately 27,4 million SEK of the intervention budget will be forwarded from Diakonia to twelve local organisations.

The overall objective of the program is to strengthen political and socio-economic accountability at national and local level by the monitoring of public policies for structural change from 2016 to 2020. The fifteen implementing partners will contribute to the five expected results in accordance with their field of competence. The five expected results are the following: 1. The democratic culture is reinforced by the continuous practice and the routinization of monitoring by citizens 2. Dialogue and Citizen Interpellation Frameworks including men and women enable adjustments to the actions of the government 3. ICTs enable real-time monitoring and strong involvement of youths and women in democratic governance 4. The Présimètre is a repository of political and socio-economic accountability 5. The technical and operational skills of Diakonia and partners are strengthened The intervention is based on a rights'-based approach and change strategy which corresponds to Diakonia's vision of the way in which the citizens' participation, non-discrimination, transparency, and accountability must be taken into account in the policies and strategies of development. A major amendment was agreed upon with Diakonia in March 2020, extending the activity period of the programme until December 31, 2020. As part of the amendment the results framework was updated somewhat, including results 1 and 2. In 2019, the Swiss Cooperation joined the donor group and with their funding an additional two partners joined the programme, focusing mainly of the participation of women and youth.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative: The results presented below are drawn from Diakonia's annual reporting for 2020. For more and earlier results please see the conclusion of performance from March 2021. Overall the programme has delivered results in a satisfactorily manner at partner level, i.e. the fifteen implementing partners who are involved in the programme. The partners have managed to deliver despite of challenges in terms of the rapidly changing security context, the volatile socio-political context, specifically in regards to the many strikes in 2019 and the Covid 19 pandemic in 2020 and 2021. The programme has managed to create spaces for dialogue between duty bearers and right holders at both local and national level, spaces which had been previously almost non existent, and thus creating a culture of accountability. The programme has managed this by using different tools (studies, opinion polls, citizen forums, documentaries, etc) and by utilising the specific competencies of each partners. Diakonia has struggled during the programme period to create an overall dynamic to ensure that the programme is greater than the sum of its parts, i.e. the glue holding all of these activities together in a coherent whole has not been strong enough. However Diakonia has slowly managed to create more synergies between the different partners and a sense of contribution to an overall objective from some of the partners, like UNALFA, ABB, ADEP, and AMR. However some implementing partners, like MBDHP and CGD, seem to be working on a parallel track, where it is difficult to see how their activities contribute to the overall picture. Furthermore, the programme had been weak in regards to gender mainstreaming and the strengthening the participation of women and youth, which was noted in the mid term review of 2019. But great progress was shown in 2020, both in terms of actual activities incorporating women's perspectives and needs, and in terms of data (with the inclusion of gender disaggregated data at a previously unseen level). Please find some some examples of results below. 1. The democratic culture is reinforced by the continuous practice and monitoring by citizens become a routine REN-LAC (Réseau national de Lutte anti-corruption) has through its annual publications on the state of corruption in Burkina Faso and through the creation of 55 anti-corruption clubs in schools contributed to the increase of denunciations of corrupt practices. In 2020, 557 complaints were registered, well over the goal of 380 complaints and a significant increase from the 379 complaints registered in 2019. The number of cases reported by women increased from 5% in 2019 to 9% in 2020. The Balai Citoyen contributed to strengthen youth participation in political decision making on local level by strengthening youth's capacity through film projections and debates, enabling their participation in municipal council meetings. ADEP (Association d'Eveil et d'appui Pugsada) contributed to the capacity strengthening of the other implementing partners of the programme through training and development of tools 2. Dialogue and Citizen Interpellation Frameworks (which include men and women) enable adjustments to the actions of the government AMR (Association Monde Rural) have supported the establishment of dialogue forums at local level (EDIC - Espace de Dialogue et d'Interpellation Communautaire) in six municipalities to achieve greater insight into to the work of municipal councils. The participation of the community has increased transparency (for instance key documents are no longer treated as confidential but are shared with the community) and has improved concrete processes such as procurements. Most importantly it has contributed to strengthen the community's trust in locally elected and has enabled a stronger participation in local development, including a higher degree of tax payment. 3. ICTs enable real-time monitoring and strong involvement of youths and women in democratic governance UNALFA (Union Nationale de l'Audiovisual Libre du Faso) transmitted the normally only televised Dialogue Citoyen on local radio. The Dialogue Citoyen show is organised by Diakonia and broadcast on the national tv channel, each episode is an interview with a high level politician, usually a minister, who is held accountable for his or her political action and vision. Transmitting these episodes on the radio permitted right holders who do not have access to a television set to listen. This activity also encouraged the radio stations to organise similar activities at local level with locally elected officials. 4. The Présimètre is a repository of political and socio-economic accountability CODEL (Convention des Organisations de la société civile pour l’Observation Domestique des Elections) trained its member organisations on gender mainstreaming. 5. The technical and operational skills of Diakonia and partners are strengthened In 2020, partners were strengthened in the area of gender mainstreaming, environment and working in insecure areas, as well as in project management. The continuous efforts with capacity strengthening in the area of gender mainstreaming has paid with several partners increasingly taking into account the different needs of women and men.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
